title: Ticket #2003: condor_ssh_to_job should work with VM universe
description:
Not urgent, but I think it's a thought worth recording:

condor_ssh_to_job ought to work with the VM universe. Currently, I can SSH into the slot running the job; however, I can't actually access the VM. I would expect that "condor_ssh_to_job <ID>" would be equivalent to: 

condor_ssh_to_job 20122.0 virsh console bbockelm_unl.edu_20122_0

Unfortunately, the nodes TTY isn't appropriately setup for user bbockelm to access it.

If condor_ssh_to_job would work for VM universe, debugging VMs would be much simpler.
remarks:
2011-Mar-29 07:48:01 by tstclair:
libvirt already has back hooks to the machine provided it's been advertised.

See virtual machine manager - connect to remote system.

2011-Mar-30 16:58:16 by bbockelm:
Hi Tim - not sure if I follow you 100%. It's pretty easy to determine the serial port assigned to the VM via libvirt, especially if you're root.

The part is how to grant the user privileges to talk to it (and only that port!). Best I could figure is use a pipe through a process that is started with root privs. Doesn't seem to be either elegant or simple though.

2011-Mar-31 07:43:45 by tstclair:
http://libvirt.org/remote.html e.g. qemu+ssh://user@system.com - opens a channel for VNC terminals to be displayed. Provided user has access.

See also: http://virt-manager.et.redhat.com/page/Main_Page

2012-Apr-25 13:23:24 by tstclair:
Yeah I stand by the qemu+ssh statement, it's a far easier model when working through libvirt & has hooks into vnc redirection.
